newsitem.title: USA: Minnesota GOs rated AAA by Standard & Poor's.
newsitem.headline: Minnesota GOs rated AAA by Standard & Poor's.

text.p: Minnesota Gov. Arne Carlson announced Thursday that Standard & Poor's has upgraded the state's general obligation bond rating to AAA from AA-plus.

Minnesota now has the highest rating from the top bond rating agencies, Carlson said in a statement. Moody's Investor's Service had upgraded Minnesota to Aaa in 1996 and Fitch Investor's Service has rated the state AAA since 1993.
"When I took office I inherited a financial mess and my number one goal was to improve Minnesota's financial management," Carlson said in a statement.
Carlson cited Minnesota's economy, large budget reserves and holding state spending below growth in personal income as key reasons for the upgrade.
Minnesota expects to sell $685 million of bonds during the next fiscal biennium, yielding a savings of $6.85 million over the next 20 years because of the upgrade, Carlson said.
